Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Frank Espino
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for serious high performance, multitrack recording, image editing video editing,this is your choice! This Laptop has it all!

Reviews.Title: I was thrilled with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Shoeaholic
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop to replace my HP Pavillion dv series and was extremely impressed and happy with this purchase. The 1 TB hybrid hard drive, Intel Core i7 processor (2.4 GHz) and 16GB RAM enables this machine to run like a beast. Boot times are under 12 seconds, recovery of sleep mode is almost instant and multi tasking between various applications is a breeze as this laptop is beyond fast.The Full HD (1920x 1080) screen has a crystal clean appearance and photos and videos are of excellent quality. Having the 2GB NVIDIA Ge Force dedicated graphics makes this laptop an easy choice for gamers. The touch screen is very responsive and easy to use but be prepared to clean your display very often. The Dr Dre Beats audio speakers are not comparable to any other laptop. The sound is clear and loud. It seems the enhanced sound comes from speakers located below the laptop in addition to the top speakers. Having 4 USB ports are a blessing alongside the HDMI port for easy connection to my TV. The fingerprint reader scans my print effortlessly and WIFI connects to my router from further distances than any of my other laptops. The only minor challenge seems to be the touchpad (mouse) whereby if I happen to use two fingers at a time it either zooms in or out whatever is on the display. Otherwise the mouse is also quite responsive when you left or right click. Windows 8.1 is easier to tolerate with the touchscreen capability. This laptop overall look and feel is quality with the silky feel of the aluminium and the thin and sophisticated look and lighter weight.Definitely a great buy!!!!The extras were worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome, powerful notebook
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Torres
Reviews.Content: I switch from an HP DV7-1020US to the Envy and the experience is been awesome. DV7 had all the trims but the Envy is modern, bright and lighter but loaded with the high performance you want for the next 5 years. If you are going to buy a computer, make an investment for the years to come. Before I purchased this unit I did a research for several months and I fall for this Envy machine... yes It is a machine, it is not your kiddo laptop...

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop!
Reviews.Author: The Sasquatch
Reviews.Content: This is a very fast laptop for the price I paid, plus I got a $175 coupon with it too. It has no optical drive but I purchased one that has slot loading and doesn't need a power supply, runs off the usb 5 volts, I don't like the windows 8.1 operating system. can't seem to get used to it. It boots up very fast. somewhere around 15 seconds. Screen is very bright, however looking at it from the side doesn't seem to good. I never have to do this so thats ok. I would recommend this computer to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect!
Reviews.Author: GeekKnowsall
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop back in Feb '14.A few tweaks I've made that give me comparable performance to my Macbook Air:- Changed the HDD from the Hybrid drive to Samsung 840 Pro 500 GB.- Installed Stardock Start8.The Samsung 840 pro is the fastest in the market when it comes to read/write speeds, and with 'Rapid mode' turned on, this machine is a BEAST! Boot time is less than 7 seconds (i.e. boot to the desktop with all startup items loaded).Stardocs Start8 gives me the much needed, fully functional Start button like Windows 7.- The display is very bright and crisp and perfect for watching HD content off Netflix/downloaded BlueRay content.- 16 GB RAM is ample to run a virtual machine off it (if required. My job required it).- The keyboard is the one that made me take 1 point away. It sometimes acts weird and skips a letter if you type fast (i promise i am good at typing and never had this issue with any other laptop).On the other note, i like the fact that you can turn the Keyboard backlight ON or OFF at will.- Gaming wise, this laptop picks up decent load, though it's not meant for heavy gaming even though it comes with this huge-ass 2 GB card. But then again, Laptops aren't meant for playing heavy games, their purpose is the pump decent amount of power along with mobility.Other thoughts:- This laptop is heavy, actually quite heavy. (I still carry my Mac-book Air to short meetings and Dropbox stuff i need to work on later)All in all, I can easily see this laptop being my best buddy for a while, until 2-3 more years hopefully.

Reviews.Title: Slow startup
Reviews.Author: Zhe Ma
Reviews.Content: not impressive. Startup is very slow. Quick CPU and large memory didn't help much on the performance. However support is very responsive although they were not able to solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Jeany Erickson
Reviews.Content: I'm still getting used to it, this being my first laptop. Windows 8 is an enigma in and of itself. Plus the battery doesn't last as long as I thought it would and what the Consumer Reports listed. Still overall it's a good laptop and would probably give it another star as soon as I figure out how everything works.

Reviews.Title: My new Envy Quad Core
Reviews.Author: Rebecca A. Lundwall, Counselor (ral1@flash.net)
Reviews.Content: Nice notebook; it's lighter than other laptops since it does not have a built in DVD/CD unit; nice downward slope on pc; for me it is the fastest notebook I've owned. My only wish is that it'd been available with windows 7, although you can install a windows 7 shell to make desktop work like windows 7. Graphics card have 2 GB of video memory. In summary everything is improved including the full HD monitor which now as soft touch feature.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Shawn P Bolan "Shawn Bolan"
Reviews.Content: Use this as my primary laptop.Small and thin-enough to be highly portable.I put an SSD and 16 GB RAM in the machine and it does everything that I need it to do including running VMware Workstation with several VMs.

Reviews.Title: Nice Device!
Reviews.Author: Kona Joe
Reviews.Content: i7 processor and 16GB RAM2TB of hard drive1920x1080 Touchscreen with 2 independent video cards (separate 2GB nVidia Geforce)Beats Audio4 USB3 ports, Ethernet, audio jack, card reader , security cable portBiometric fingerprint logonand I am sure I missed something.Custom configured to my specs from available options, came exactly as I ordered.  Light weight and runs everything I use in the workplace (lots of specialty software).  Decent battery life (coast to coast flights).The only thing wrong with this notebook is that it comes with Windows 8.1!

Reviews.Title: Just have to see the specs!!
Reviews.Author: Juan Danilow
Reviews.Content: It is a very good laptop, just have to see the specs. I have no problem with the keyboard, from what I've read where it says otherwise. No complaints, just have to adapt to the new operating system concepts that are quite happy with the touch.

Reviews.Title: Performance is very good happy with that part. I was hoping for it to be a lot lighted then it is outwith the isc drive
Reviews.Author: Timmy
Reviews.Content: Performance is very good happy with that part. I was hoping for it to be a lot lighted then it is outwith the isc drive

Reviews.Title: I LOVED IT
Reviews.Author: silvia moran
Reviews.Content: THE FASTER THAT IS THIS LAPTOP .HP HAVE A GOOD YOOB IN THIS COMPUTER IS VERY VEERY AMAZING .

Reviews.Title: I kept my MAC and turned this computer back into my company.
Reviews.Author: Brian Bingel
Reviews.Content: I've been using a MAC and thought I could switch over to a PC because it ran some of our business software, but I ended up turning the Envy back into the company for another employee and I'm keeping my MAC.  I didn't care for windows eight and all the security features that for whatever reason, HP chooses to load on the computers that annoy the heck out of you and are difficult to remove.
